cards.html: This is You Love To See It — a weekly feature reviewing good news, progress and action steps that’s one of the many features available only to Daily Poster supporting subscribers. Thank you so much for being a supporting subscriber — we couldn’t do this reporting without your support.  CLICK HERE to add comments to this story online. And if you like this report, you can use the tip jar.
Feel free to forward this email on to others to encourage them to subscribe! And if you want to use our tip jar, click here.

sections: In 2019, conservative West Virginia Democrat Joe Manchin co-sponsored the “For the People Act,” his party’s landmark voting rights and democracy reform legislation. But sticking with his current plan to be the ultimate political wet blanket, earlier this week he announced he’ll oppose the bill this year because it “has garnered zero Republican support.”
Reform advocates are now working to change Manchin’s mind on the bill — and one of the main people leading the charge happens to have a long history with the West Virginia senator.
All of this and more in this week’s You Love To See It below, exclusive for paid subscribers!
Scoop That You Love To See:
Manchin Ally Pushes Him On Voting Rights Bill
) — Mike Plante, who worked on one of Manchin’s gubernatorial campaigns, told

he is serving as a consultant to the West Virginia Freedom Alliance Action Fund, which has already run $220,000 worth of television ads pressing Manchin to support the “For the People Act,” Democrats’ landmark voting rights and democracy reform legislation. Read our full scoop on the matter
Things That You Love To See:
Vast Majority of Voters Want Higher Taxes on Wealthy, Corporations
— Nearly 7 in 10 voters support raising taxes on the wealthy and corporations, according to a

from ALG Research, Hart Research, and Americans for Tax Fairness. Moreover, voters become more supportive of President Joe Biden’s economic plans when they are told they will be funded by taxes on the wealthy and corporations.
Senate Progressives Warn Joe Biden That He Needs Their Votes, Too

) —  Could progressive senators be learning a lesson from their moderate colleagues? “Progressive senators have so far sat quietly on the sidelines throughout infrastructure negotiations. But they’ve gotten more vocal this week about their priorities — such as investments aimed at electrifying the nation’s vehicles in order to combat climate change — being left out of any eventual deal,”
, but maybe this time we will end up pleasantly surprised.
Biden Reverses One of Trump’s “Most Reckless and Irresponsible” Decisions

) — “Conservation advocates are gearing up for a major win. On Friday, the Forest Service said it would “repeal or replace” a Trump-era rollback that allows companies to build roads and other infrastructure in much of America’s largest national forest. It could be [the] biggest victory for public lands the Biden administration has delivered yet — if the details pan out.”
Alabama’s Coal Miners Are Striking for Their Lives
) — Over 1,000 coal miners in Brookwood, Alabama have been on strike since April 1 of this year. “But I’m not going to give up, because that’s what they want,” one of the striking miners told
Thousands Came to Minnesota to Protest New Construction on the Line 3 Pipeline

) — “By Monday night, some 200 protesters had been arrested as they attempted to stop the construction of Enbridge’s Line 3 replacement project. Many had chained themselves to pipeline construction equipment hoping to delay a project that they say would lock Minnesota — and the nation — into decades of continued burning of some of the world’s dirtiest oil and threatens the pristine waterways that many Indigenous people depend on for their livelihoods.”

“Obamacare for me means paying a second rent to have a plastic card in my pocket. Disaster insurance. I can't afford the out of pocket, so getting actual healthcare means going into debt. It's better than the nothing I could get before, but not actual healthcare. I can only hope not to be one of the 1 in 6 (!!!) claims that get rejected, leaving one with huge bills. This is not a solution and shame on Democrats who suggest it is. Another global crisis passes, another historic opportunity lost.” — Phil, commenting on
Treaty People Gathering, an organization involved in coordinating the resistance to the Enbridge Line 3 pipeline in Minnesota, wants you to
